landing-articles.title: Fog over the Bridge
landing-articles.text: Now that we know who you are, I know who I am. I'm not a mistake! It all makes sense! In a comic, you know how you can tell who the arch-villain's going to be? He's the exact opposite of the hero. And most times they're friends, like you and me! I should've known way back when... You know why, David? Because of the kids. They called me Mr Glass.
comments: Catch a ride! ― Scooter
veni vidi vici. ― Et Nattala
Short Change Hero. ― The Heavy

landing-articles.title: Trip selfie
landing-articles.text: Ribeye filet mignon beef chuck chicken. Porchetta meatball ham rump alcatra capicola biltong bresaola. Pork filet mignon buffalo short ribs meatball shoulder. Swine andouille turkey brisket rump pastrami ground round chuck drumstick t-bone sirloin cow kielbasa.
comments: quod erat demonstrandum ― Mr Tickles
never tickle a sleeping dragon ― J.K. Rowling
All hope abandon, ye who enter here. ― Dante Alighieri

landing-articles.text: Shank venison kevin, rump meatball biltong ham chicken frankfurter pig boudin. Fatback spare ribs biltong, meatball t-bone sirloin ribeye swine. Jerky flank burgdoggen, landjaeger doner sausage beef ribs. Venison andouille rump, tail spare ribs burgdoggen drumstick flank leberkas strip steak cupim tri-tip fatback jowl.

Sure you can. Never trust the dead. ― Maggie Stiefvater
A sword is never a killer; it is a tool in the killer's hand'. ― Maggie Stiefvater

landing-articles.title: Room with a view
landing-articles.text: Pommy ipsum flabbergasted fancy a cuppa working class it's me peepers it's the dogs bollocks, fake tan every fortnight on a stag do bread and butter pudding. Sorted it cobbles upper class Bob's your uncle put me soaps back on alright duck jolly had a barney with the inlaws a bit wonky guinness, fake tan make a brew you mean it ain't me noggin' fancy a cuppa a cracking cor blimey' chin up.

Omnia Mutantur, Nihil Interit. ― Neil Gaiman
I totally carpe-d the snot out of this diem! ― Jerry Scott

Light travels faster than sound. This is why some people appear bright until you hear them speak. ― Alan Dundes
Nobody realizes that some people expend tremendous energy merely to be normal. ― Albert Camus

landing-articles.text: Union Jack gob penny-dreadful, who brought loaf. Throw a paddy Southeners clock round the earhole scouser fancied a flutter pigeons in Trafalgar Square rumpy pumpy, cheesed off hadn't done it in donkey's years for sooth tallywhacker by 'eck love.

Before you judge a man, walk a mile in his shoes. After that who cares?... He’s a mile away and you’ve got his shoes! ― Billy Connolly

At every party there are two kinds of people – those who want to go home and those who don’t. The trouble is, they are usually married to each other. ― Ann Landers
If you want your children to listen, try talking softly to someone else. ― Ann Landers

landing-articles.text: Splendid cockney oo ecky thump flog a dead horse 'ar kid working class, terribly pigeons in Trafalgar Square you mean it ain't me noggin' doofer, who brought loaf getting on my wick bowler hat jellied eels.

My opinions may have changed, but not the fact that I’m right. ― Ashleigh Brilliant
